entry.title: I slept through Into the afterlife (It was nice)
entry.summary:
Author: deanbane

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,479Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: ‘Dear Holy Father in the Sky,’ he started. ‘It has been a long time since I’ve spoken to you, and apologies for it not being in a church or anywhere holy – life’s been shitty lately, but I am sure that You’re having a fucking fit about it with Shannon in heaven.’Or;Eddie Diaz was supposed to be dead after the shot, but for some reason, he was thrown into a time loop, and he had to re-live the horror of being shot in front of Buck all over again.

entry.title: I want to be me (is that not allowed?)
entry.summary:
Author: Tamystardust

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,887Chapters: 7/11Kudos: 451

Summary: “Buck?” Eddie called, worried. He was already half out of his chair when Buck came back to the kitchen.Panic all over his face, he looked between Chris and Eddie. “What’s going on?”“So… just so that we’re on the same page,” Buck whispered, trying to remain collected, but looking at Chris, “you didn’t call your grandparents, right?”“What? No!” Chris replied at the same volume, looking between Buck and Eddie with horror.“What-““Because they’re currently at our front door,” Buck finally said, still a whisper.

entry.title: Locket 118
entry.summary:
Author: aurehose

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,478Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Buck’s life changes when his blog outed him as trans, forcing him to face high school with a new, unwanted spotlight. Eddie, a quiet football player with a secret crush on Buck, begins to quietly support him, even standing up to his friends. As their paths cross more, a slow-burning connection begins to form, but both have their own emotional battles to fight before they can fully understand what they mean to each other.

entry.title: En otra vida | in another life
entry.summary:
Author: The_Inefable_mexa17

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,974Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 35

Summary: “We should talk” Buck said sitting at the kitchen table his coffee in his hands. They had gotten up and made breakfast, just like the times Buck spent the night on the couch.“Yeah” Eddie leaned back on the countertop.“We were drunk, and it was stupid, plus you are straight” Buck said.“I don’t think I’m straight” Eddie laughed.“I mean” Buck took a sip in his coffee “it doesn’t have to mean anything”“Right” Eddie’s heart sunk but he nodded “And you just got dump”“So you agree” Buck smiled “This doesn’t have to ruin our friendship or change anything.”“Yeah of course, dude” Eddie buried his feelings, something that he was good at “Nothing has to change"orBuck and Eddie sleep together the night Buck got dumped, but decided they should stay friends. But when Eddie decided to move to texas to be closer to his son, they are force to face their feelings

entry.title: exactly what i want and who i want to be
entry.summary:
Author: secretlyhuman

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,984Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 12

Summary: “I- I got struck by lightning recently so I’ve been sort of taking stock, I guess. Because everyone’s sort of looking at me now, like I have some sort of answer. Or could find some sort of meaning in it. And I haven’t. And- Sorry that was probably too much to dump on a stranger.” He’s got used to ignoring the way the look on people’s faces change when he says the lightning thing, still he almost flinches from the way her laugh drops off in her throat, smile sliding away and eyes softening.“Near death experience and your first worry was if you’d left a trail of unsatisfied women behind you?”“Something like that.”“I mean, I might be way off base because I’ve spent like a total of two hours with you and for most of that we weren’t talking exactly. But I don’t think you’re gonna find your answers in calling ex hookups.” She pauses, biting her lip in a way that’s more nervous than anything else. “Did you sort it out with that guy you were seeing?”“Sorry, what?”

entry.title: kitchen flowers
entry.summary:
Author: spiderkola

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,810Chapters: 5/10Kudos: 9

Summary: The slow shuffle out of the chapel felt clumsy, almost embarrassingly ordinary. With the priest gone, so too was the illusion of sanctity. Eddie felt human again—tethered to the ground, stripped of significance. Every step was an echo, his body heavy and his thought heavier. The sky outside was no brighter than it had been when they arrived. He turned to Buck, words forming before he had the courage to speak them.But then Buck looked at him. And Eddie stopped.It hit him, then—not that Buck was handsome in some odd or unconventional way. No, he was devastating; breathtaking in a way that felt almost impossible to define.“What did you learn?” Buck asked, his voice even, neutral. That I could deny myself of joy; spend a lifetime convincing myself you’re not the person I want; force myself to find love in tighter arms—and still, no one comes close to you. I promise you, you’re better than the rest.  Or,Glances in London and heartbreak in Vienna. Somewhere between maps, museums, and shared silence, they forgot not to fall in love.

entry.title: just a little bit of your heart (is all I'm asking for)
entry.summary:
Author: dbolterstar

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 100,106Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 89

Summary: “Does this change a thing between us?” Buck asks, his voice low, his hands still framing Eddie’s face. He can feel the unsteady breaths leaving Eddie’s lips, warm against his own. Eddie looks wrecked. His cheeks are flushed, lips red and kiss-swollen, his glassy eyes locked on Buck’s mouth like it’s the only thing he can see. He looks as hungry as Buck feels. Buck feels Eddie’s fingers trace along his arms, squeezing just enough to leave his skin tingling. “I don’t know.” It’s not a yes—Buck’s not even sure he wants to hear a yes. But it’s so much better than the rejection Eddie threw at him before. “Alright,” Buck exhales, nodding like it’s nothing, even though it feels massive. Then he surges forward, catching Eddie’s mouth in his again. The soft, desperate sound Eddie lets out—like relief and need tangled together—hits Buck like a punch to the chest. or; Eddie’s shame torments him. Buck would rather have a piece of Eddie than nothing at all. Miscommunication is their biggest enemy. Infidelity turns into their savior… or ends up being the thing that destroys them?

Worried about how vulnerable new immortals are to headhunters Richie opts to stay in LA to try and convince him of his new immortality and see if he can help. Unable to corner him, Richie decides the only way to talk to him and make Buck listen is to join the 118 firehouse.

You are safe. You can only help to get them out if you calm down, okay?” too afraid of losing everyone, buck panics and calls eddieset post 8x14

entry.title: When the Smoke Settles
entry.summary:
Author: shadowtvwrites

Summary: Eddie eyes locked on the words splayed across the bottom of the screen:BREAKING NEWS: Biohazard Fire in Downtown LA – Reports of Firefighters Trapped InsideFirefighters.Eddie felt his chest tighten uncomfortably.OREddie finds out about the 118 getting trapped in the biohazard facility through the news.

entry.title: Hot Guy at the End of My Bed
entry.summary:
Author: PheonixInk

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 716Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 171

Summary: Buck wakes up from surgery groggy, confused, and most importantly entranced by the insanely hot guy hovering at the end of his hospital bed. He starts flirting shamelessly, unaware that the man is actually his husband. Eddie is mostly amused. Mostly.

entry.title: An Ordinary Video Call
entry.summary:
Author: AmATruck

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,200Chapters: 5/5Kudos: 143

Summary: Buck is asked to join a video call with Eddie that afternoon, after only a week of fleeting texts. Buck thinks it'll be a great chance to catch up, to try and ignore what Tommy said.But Eddie wanted to call for more than just chit-chat. He's got something big to tell Buck.

entry.title: yesterday’s gone (today’s almost spent)
entry.summary:
Author: markofalover

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,703Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 930

Summary: “Buck,” he says. Quiet. He keeps leaning forward until his forehead bumps against the glass. “You gotta—you gotta listen to me, okay?” Buck’s shaking his head before Eddie’s even finished with his sentence. “No, don’t—don’t start. Please.” ...or, Eddie’s in the lab.
